channel.title: Ip problem
channel.description:
i have a problem my ip changes when i reboot(making me unbannable :D) so i dno how to host a server :S and when i go to start and click run and type in cmd then ipconfig i get this : Microsoft Windows XP [Version 5.1.2600] (C) Copyright 1985-2001 Microsoft Corp.
C:\Documents and Settings\Student>ipconfig 'ipconfig' is not recognized as an internal or external command, operable program or batch file.
C:\Documents and Settings\Student>
p.s thats the problems

item.title: Ip problem
item.dc:creator: @true_mager true mager
item.description:
@true_mager wrote:

HELP :s ALSO WHEN I RUN OR COMPILE I GET THIS INTERNAL OR EXTERNAL COMMAND ERROR :s

Read full topic

item.title: Ip problem
item.dc:creator: @viruz_3 viruz 3
item.description:
@viruz_3 wrote:

[quote=“true mager, post:3, topic:134791”]i dont understand, should i log on my comp as adminastrator
and i i got the no-ip and stuff like on forums my ip and hostname is my ip :S

i got no-ip and DUC
like when i do the ports on my ip it reboots my internet causing my ip to change :S[/quote]
Yes, Try logging onto your Administrator account then try ipconfig /all. Post here even if you dont do it.

Read full topic

item.title: Ip problem
item.dc:creator: @RXVL RXVL
item.description:
@RXVL wrote:

A no IP is ment for that, log on as an administrator and configure your router to accept port 43594 or 5555 or whatever you guys use these days and your DUC should update your IP everytime.

Read full topic

item.title: Ip problem
item.dc:creator: @true_mager true mager
item.description:
@true_mager wrote:

i dont understand, should i log on my comp as adminastrator
and i i got the no-ip and stuff like on forums my ip and hostname is my ip :S

i got no-ip and DUC
like when i do the ports on my ip it reboots my internet causing my ip to change :S

Read full topic

item.title: Ip problem
item.dc:creator: @RXVL RXVL
item.description:
@RXVL wrote:

YOu on a limited account that wont let you, but get a no-ip and download the DUC, that should help.

Read full topic
